Sentence: Jean Louise's older brother, Jem, died of a sudden heart condition a few years ago when he (brother) was only in his (brother) early twenties
Jean Louise has flashbacks to her (Louise) childhood with Jem and her (Louise) childhood friend, Dill
The meeting is in the courthouse, and Jean Louise watches it from the same place where she (Louise) and Jem sat as children to watch their father defend a black man who was on trial for rape
This was the first time that Jean Louise really began to feel like she (Louise) was becoming a woman, not just a child or Jem's little sister
